[ 3 syll. ai-me-ry, aim-ery ] The baby boy name Aimery is pronounced EY-Meh-Riy- †. Aimery is of Germanic origin and it is used mainly in French. Aimery's meaning is 'king of work'. In addition, Aimery is a French form of the English Emery. Aimery is a widely used name; it has 23 forms. Forms include Aime, Aimerea, Aimeree, Aimerey, Aimeri, Aimeric, Aimerie, Aimoree, Aimorey, Aimori, Aimorie, Aimory, Ameree, Amerey, Ameri, Americ, Amerie, Amery, Aymerey, Aymeri, Aymeric, Aymerie, and Aymery. Aimery is not popular as a baby name for boys. It is not in the top 1000 names. Out of the group of boy names directly related to Aimery, Emery was the most frequently used in 2012

Aimery /aim-ery/ [3 sylls.] as a boys' name is of Old German origin, and the meaning of Aimery is king of work. French name. Aimery is pronounced similarly to Aimory, Amery, Amory, Emery ▼ and Emmery. Other recommended similar baby names are Amer, Ammer, Amry and Aymer. These names tend to be more commonly used than Aimery.

Amery is an unusual given name for men but a somewhat prominent surname for both adults and children (#94227 out of 150436, Top 63%). (2000 U.S. Census). Amery /ame-ry/ [3 sylls.] as a boys' name is of Old German derivation, and Amery means brave power. Amery is an alternate spelling of Amory (Old German): transcription of Emery.
